newsitem.title: DUBAI: Ousted Afghan president in Iran.
newsitem.headline: Ousted Afghan president in Iran.

text.p: Ousted Afghan president Burhanuddin Rabbani arrived in Iran on Monday for a one-day visit, the official Iranian news agency IRNA reported.
It said Rabbani, who is supported by Iran, will hold talks with senior officials including first Vice-President Hassan Habibi and Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Velayati.
Iran brands the Islamic Taleban which in September overran Kabul as "rebels" giving Islam a bad name and says the only solution to the Afghan crisis is dialogue among all the factions.
